items.title: Update PyPi with tarball including license file
items.body:
Hi,

I'm in the process of packaging this for Fedora as it's been identified as a dependency for the LetsEncrypt client.

The Fedora packaging guidelines have a strong preference to the license being in a separate file from upstream that can then be included.

This file appears to already be in the github repo but is missing from the tarball over on Pypi.

Could you please upload a new archive to PyPi including this?

items.title: [PATCH] Failing test for set round-tripping
items.body:
One of the round-trip tests failed the first time I ran it:

```
rmunn@laptop:~/code/python/edn_format (master)$ python tests.py 
......F.
======================================================================
FAIL: test_round_trip_conversion (__main__.EdnTest)
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "tests.py", line 140, in test_round_trip_conversion
    self.assertIn(step3, literal[1])
AssertionError: '#{:b (1 2 3) :a}' not found in ['#{:a (1 2 3) :b}', '#{(1 2 3) :a :b}', '#{:a :b (1 2 3)}', '#{:b :a (1 2 3)}']

----------------------------------------------------------------------
Ran 8 tests in 0.447s

FAILED (failures=1)
```

There are six possible permutations of `:a`, `:b`, and `(1 2 3)`, but only four of those permutations are checked for in the test results. The following patch will check for the other two possible permutations:

``` patch
diff --git a/tests.py b/tests.py
index df26228..6a272ab 100644
--- a/tests.py
+++ b/tests.py
@@ -126,7 +126,9 @@ class EdnTest(unittest.TestCase):
             ["+32.23M", "32.23M"],
             ["3.23e10", "32300000000.0"],
             ['#{:a (1 2 3) :b}', ['#{:a (1 2 3) :b}',
+                                  '#{:b (1 2 3) :a}',
                                   '#{(1 2 3) :a :b}',
+                                  '#{(1 2 3) :b :a}',
                                   '#{:a :b (1 2 3)}',
                                   '#{:b :a (1 2 3)}']]
         ]
```

The patch is simple enough that I'm not going to bother with setting up a pull request, though I can do so if you'd prefer.

items.title: import fails on python3
items.body:
hi, I'm using edn_format that depends on this lib, it fails to load on python 3 because the lines

```
from generator import generate                                                
from parser import parse 
```

fail, I fixed it using relative imports

```
from .generator import generate                                                
from .parser import parse 
```

maybe you prefer another solution

to reproduce do sudo pip3 install pyrfc3339 and then try importing it using python3
